score.title: All The World's A Frickin' Stage
paragraphs: The director slept with half the cast, your lighting designer is homicidal and that bastard from the Daily News just panned the show in his column. You'll be lucky on opening night if the cast remembers their lines, nobody mentions the Scottish Play and the scenery doesn't fall down mid-performance. But hey, the art is all that's important, right?
Break A Leg! is a tribute to the grand traditions and superstitions of the Theatre — from the casting couch to the Great White Way.
